p: AMIV was isolated from wild adult Anopheles minimus, a major Southeast Asian malaria vector, after inoculation of C6/36 cells with mosquito extract [ 35]. BHK21 and Vero-E6 cells can also be infected with AMIV, with a significant cytopathic effect [ 66]. AMIV is the first iridovirus isolated from Anopheles species. An Ae. aegypti iridovirus (IIV-6) causes cytopathic damage leading to the reduction of body size, fecundity and longevity. Horizontal transmission by cannibalism and vertical transmission of IIV-3 were observed in Ochlerotatus taeniorhynchus [ 67]. Iridovirus infection leads to an apoptotic response in invertebrate and vertebrate cells [ 67].
